intro: Symphyotrichum bimater, commonly known as the two-parent aster, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and prairies, preferring well-drained soils. It produces showy purple to pink flowers in the fall, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Symphyotrichum bimater is also valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
